chunks.en: Nurse girlfriend scheduling problem. Her work hours are not fixed, setting the alarm every day is troublesome, sometimes she works at 7:30, sometimes at 9, any good ideas?

chunks.en: I usually give this advice: 1. If she works at 7:30 tomorrow, then you get up at 7, make breakfast and wake her up. 2. If she works at 9 tomorrow, then you get up at 7, make breakfast and keep it warm in the pot, and set her alarm for 8:30. 3. If she is off tomorrow and does not need to work, then you get up at 7, make breakfast and keep it warm in the pot and wait for her to sleep until she wakes up naturally. ğŸ˜‚
@pigf #9 You're welcome. What affects sleep the most is not time, but the routine. It is important to ensure a regular sleep and wake-up time.
Find the pattern of the schedule, the best way is to get up at 6:30 every day, you will never be late
Do you have so much extra energy?
If there is a pattern, you can set it according to the pattern, or you can use a voice assistant.
If it's iOS, get two NFC tags, set shortcut commands to set the alarm
@evan9527 npy: I thank you
My wife is also a nurse, I use an outlock calendar to sync the phone calendar, fill the schedule into the calendar, and set the alarm reminder
@littlecreek If you hold a hammer in your hand, everything looks like a nail...
Hey Siri, 7 am alarm, how difficult is this...
You misunderstood, your girlfriend doesn't want you to implement the alarm clock solution for when it rings, but wants you to implement the solution for no alarm clock
Really feel â€œhow to live without a phoneâ€
Buy a smart speaker, for example, I often say: Xiao Ai, wake me up at xx o'clock
If the hospital has a scheduling system, grab the packets yourself. I used to do it this way.
Excel import then write a script for an alarm clock
You can always get up at 6:30, and if you work at 9:30, you can do something else, such as xxx. If it's 7:30, then don't do it and just go directly.
I set alarms for different times and turn them on manually before going to bed

chunks.en: First, you need to have a schedule, access it to the calendar or be able to read it with a stable interface or web content recognition, and then according to the schedule time, you can use tools like IFTTT, MacroDroid to automatically set the alarm clock based on the calendar.
Siri
Just set it for tomorrow before you go to bed
